SEARCH
Package schedStateMachine

Class CheckAndHandleMessage

java.lang.Object
schedStateMachine.SchedulerState
schedStateMachine.CheckAndHandleMessage
public class CheckAndHandleMessage extends SchedulerState
checks mailbox for messages from floor and elevator and handles them

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CheckAndHandleMessage()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    handleAckTravelToFloor(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
    Handles ACK_TRAVEL_TO_FLOOR message received from an elevator and inserts a fault if applicable: - if the job has a fault that has not already been fulfilled and the random coin toss returns true, then a FAULT_DOOR message will be sent - otherwise, a CLOSE_DOOR message will be sent
    void
    handleConfirmDoorClosed(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
    Handles messages of the type CONFIRM_DOOR_CLOSED that were received from the elevator: - sends a new message to the elevator of the type REQUEST_CURRENT_FLOOR_UPDATE
    void
    handleConfirmDoorOpened(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
    Handles messages of the type CONFIRM_DOOR_OPENED that were received from the elevator: - send back a REQUEST_UNLOADING_COMPLETE_CONFIRMATION message
    void
    handleConfirmLoadingUnloadingComplete(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
    Handles messages of the type CONFIRM_LOADING_UNLOADING_COMPLETE that were received from the elevator: - check which jobs are COMPLETED in this elevator's jobs list, and add them to the Scheduler completedJobs list - check which jobs in this elevator's jobs list have the START_FLOOR_COMPLETED status and set their isFulfilledStartingFloor flag - if this elevator has more jobs assigned to it, find the next job that correlates with the next stop for this elevator: - if there is more than 1 job, pick one according to rules - if there are none, we do not send any messages out - send out the next job if there is one as a TRAVEL_TO_FLOOR message
    void
    handleConfirmStopped(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
    Handles messages of the type CONFIRM_STOPPED that were received from the elevator: - if the job has a SOFT_FAULT that has not been fulfilled yet: - we send a FAULT_DOOR message if the random coin toss is true or we are already at the destination floor (last chance to send a fault) - otherwise we send an OPEN_DOOR message - if the job has no fault, we send an OPEN_DOOR message
    void
    handleCurrentFloorUpdate(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
    Handles messages of the type CURRENT_FLOOR_UPDATE that were received from the elevator and inserts a STUCK fault if applicable: - if the message has a HARD_FAULT that has not already been fulfilled, the scheduler will insert a fault at this time if either: - the random coin toss returns true OR - this is the last chance to insert a fault for this job (we are at the floor right before the destination floor) - if a fault is to be inserted, the scheduler sends out a FAULT_STUCK message to the elevator - otherwise, the scheduler sends out either: - a STOP message + a REQUEST_STOPPED_CONFIRMATION message, if the elevator has arrived at a scheduled stop OR - a MOVE message if the elevator should keep travelling
    void
    handleInitialReadFromFile(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
    Handles messages of the type INITIAL_READ_FROM_FILE that were received from the floors: - adds the message to the Scheduler initialReadFromFile list - picks an elevator according to Algorithm and assigns the job to it - adds that job to the elevator's jobs list - if that elevator is currently idle with no jobs to do, it sends a TRAVEL_TO_FLOOR command
    void
    handleReportDoorNotClosing(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
    Handles messages of the type REPORT_DOOR_NOT_CLOSING that were received from the elevator: - sends a new message to the elevator to close the door
    void
    handleReportDoorNotOpening(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
    Handles messages of the type REPORT_DOOR_NOT_OPENING that were received from the elevator: - report that the elevator has a door opening fault - send the elevator another OPEN_DOOR
    void
    handleReportStuck(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
    Handles messages of the type REPORT_STUCK that were received from the elevator: - send the elevator an OUT_OF_ORDER message and an OPEN_DOOR message - resend the elevator's current jobs as INITIAL_READ_FROM_FILE messages to the Scheduler so that they can be reprocessed and be assigned to a different elevator - jobs are modified as follows: - if the job has the starting floor fulfilled, set its starting floor to the current floor (irl the passengers that are already in the elevator get out and call another elevator at their current floor) - otherwise, send the job unchanged
    void
    setTimer(Scheduler context)
     
    void
    timeout(Scheduler context)
     

    Methods inherited from class schedStateMachine.SchedulerState

    checkMsgs, displayState, respondMsg, respondMsg, schedOperation, sleep

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • handleInitialReadFromFile

      public void handleInitialReadFromFile(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
      Handles messages of the type INITIAL_READ_FROM_FILE that were received from the floors: - adds the message to the Scheduler initialReadFromFile list - picks an elevator according to Algorithm and assigns the job to it - adds that job to the elevator's jobs list - if that elevator is currently idle with no jobs to do, it sends a TRAVEL_TO_FLOOR command
      Parameters:
      context - : the scheduler context
      currentMsg - : the message received by the scheduler

    • handleAckTravelToFloor

      public void handleAckTravelToFloor(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
      Handles ACK_TRAVEL_TO_FLOOR message received from an elevator and inserts a fault if applicable: - if the job has a fault that has not already been fulfilled and the random coin toss returns true, then a FAULT_DOOR message will be sent - otherwise, a CLOSE_DOOR message will be sent
      Parameters:
      context - : the scheduler context
      currentMsg - : the message received by the scheduler

    • handleReportDoorNotClosing

      public void handleReportDoorNotClosing(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
      Handles messages of the type REPORT_DOOR_NOT_CLOSING that were received from the elevator: - sends a new message to the elevator to close the door
      Parameters:
      context - : the scheduler context
      currentMsg - : the message received by the scheduler

    • handleConfirmDoorClosed

      public void handleConfirmDoorClosed(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
      Handles messages of the type CONFIRM_DOOR_CLOSED that were received from the elevator: - sends a new message to the elevator of the type REQUEST_CURRENT_FLOOR_UPDATE
      Parameters:
      context - : the scheduler context
      currentMsg - : the message received by the scheduler

    • handleCurrentFloorUpdate

      public void handleCurrentFloorUpdate(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
      Handles messages of the type CURRENT_FLOOR_UPDATE that were received from the elevator and inserts a STUCK fault if applicable: - if the message has a HARD_FAULT that has not already been fulfilled, the scheduler will insert a fault at this time if either: - the random coin toss returns true OR - this is the last chance to insert a fault for this job (we are at the floor right before the destination floor) - if a fault is to be inserted, the scheduler sends out a FAULT_STUCK message to the elevator - otherwise, the scheduler sends out either: - a STOP message + a REQUEST_STOPPED_CONFIRMATION message, if the elevator has arrived at a scheduled stop OR - a MOVE message if the elevator should keep travelling
      Parameters:
      context - : the scheduler context
      currentMsg - : the message received by the scheduler

    • handleReportStuck

      public void handleReportStuck(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
      Handles messages of the type REPORT_STUCK that were received from the elevator: - send the elevator an OUT_OF_ORDER message and an OPEN_DOOR message - resend the elevator's current jobs as INITIAL_READ_FROM_FILE messages to the Scheduler so that they can be reprocessed and be assigned to a different elevator - jobs are modified as follows: - if the job has the starting floor fulfilled, set its starting floor to the current floor (irl the passengers that are already in the elevator get out and call another elevator at their current floor) - otherwise, send the job unchanged
      Parameters:
      context - : the scheduler context
      currentMsg - : the message received by the scheduler

    • handleConfirmStopped

      public void handleConfirmStopped(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
      Handles messages of the type CONFIRM_STOPPED that were received from the elevator: - if the job has a SOFT_FAULT that has not been fulfilled yet: - we send a FAULT_DOOR message if the random coin toss is true or we are already at the destination floor (last chance to send a fault) - otherwise we send an OPEN_DOOR message - if the job has no fault, we send an OPEN_DOOR message
      Parameters:
      context - : the scheduler context
      currentMsg - : the message received by the scheduler

    • handleReportDoorNotOpening

      public void handleReportDoorNotOpening(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
      Handles messages of the type REPORT_DOOR_NOT_OPENING that were received from the elevator: - report that the elevator has a door opening fault - send the elevator another OPEN_DOOR
      Parameters:
      context - : the scheduler context
      currentMsg - : the message received by the scheduler

    • handleConfirmDoorOpened

      public void handleConfirmDoorOpened(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
      Handles messages of the type CONFIRM_DOOR_OPENED that were received from the elevator: - send back a REQUEST_UNLOADING_COMPLETE_CONFIRMATION message
      Parameters:
      context - : the scheduler context
      currentMsg - : the message received by the scheduler

    • handleConfirmLoadingUnloadingComplete

      public void handleConfirmLoadingUnloadingComplete(Scheduler context, Message currentMsg)
      Handles messages of the type CONFIRM_LOADING_UNLOADING_COMPLETE that were received from the elevator: - check which jobs are COMPLETED in this elevator's jobs list, and add them to the Scheduler completedJobs list - check which jobs in this elevator's jobs list have the START_FLOOR_COMPLETED status and set their isFulfilledStartingFloor flag - if this elevator has more jobs assigned to it, find the next job that correlates with the next stop for this elevator: - if there is more than 1 job, pick one according to rules - if there are none, we do not send any messages out - send out the next job if there is one as a TRAVEL_TO_FLOOR message
      Parameters:
      context - : the scheduler context
      currentMsg - : the message received by the scheduler
